etymology.description: pictogram — a sharp peg; same as 弋 and 尗; see also the top component of 𢦏. Xu Shen erroneously analyzed it as a sprout.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a sharp peg or stake, closely related to the forms 弋 and 尗. The modern senses “talent” and “only then” developed later through semantic extension and loan usage. Xu Shen’s sprout analysis reflects a visual misinterpretation rather than the historical form.

examples.chinese: 我刚到(我剛到)，他才开始(他才開始)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gāng dào, tā cái kāishǐ.
examples.english: I just arrived, and only then did he start.

examples.chinese: 她十八岁才学中文(她十八歲才學中文)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shíbā suì cái xué Zhōngwén.
examples.english: She only started learning Chinese at eighteen.

examples.chinese: 这孩子很有才(這孩子很有才)，写作特别好(寫作特別好)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè háizi hěn yǒu cái, xiězuò tèbié hǎo.
examples.english: This child is very talented; the writing is especially good.
